original_title: Token strike launched by health professionals ends
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The token strike launched by health professionals will end on Friday (12).
The strike was launched demanding the Rs.35,000 allowance granted to doctors be given to them as well.

A diverse group of trade unions representing Public Health Inspectors, Entomologists, Dental Therapists at Schools, Compounding Pharmacists, ECG Technicians, EEG Technicians, Ophthalmologists, Public Health Laboratory Technicians and Dental Technicians are part of the token strike.
Patients were severely burdened on Thursday (11), due to the strike action.

President of the Public Health Inspector's Union of Sri Lanka Upul Rohana said a discussion was held with the Secretary to the Ministry of Health, where he requested health professionals to report to work and promised to take action in his capacity.
Upul Rohana said however trade union action will continue until 8am on Friday (12), as they did not receive a favourable response.

He said discussions were held with several health unions to launch trade union action on the 16th of January, adding that they expect the government and Minister of Health to intervene to provide a favourable response.
The token strike launched by the minor staff demanding an allowance of Rs.35,000 ended at 6.30am on Friday (12).
Secretary to the Sri Lanka Freedom Health Service Union Roy De Mel said a discussion will be held on Friday (12) regarding future trade union action.
